intro: Bartsia longiflora subsp. macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaved bartsia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic species. The plant is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow to white flowers. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as woodlands and rocky slopes. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and often overlooked member of the flora in its native habitats.
